column4: i'm using the live CD. is there a way to eject the CD to free up the drive without installing to the hard disk?
i can neither eject the disk manually nor unmount it
and i have a hunch overriding the tray lock will lead to disaster
i do have enough ram to keep the cd content in a ramdisk however, if thats an option
i asked how to eject the live cd while running it
unless you used TORAM=yes when booting it, there is a very good reson it won't allow ejection...
yeah, because it keeps it mounted i suppose
I'm not sure, but I know it worked for me WITH, capitalization.
hmmm... now its freezing on boot :(
Well, it needs to load the whole CD to RAM, it will take a while...
the cd drive is inactive. its spun down and i can even take out the disk

Hmm, well in that case, maybe it failed, I'm not sure if there was a huge amount of testing done with the option, it was simply enabled, since a long-standing bug had been fixed which blocked it, might now work for your machine then :(
i see. to be sure i checked the cd for defects but it came out fine.
i'll think up something different then... thanks for the hint though :)
